title: filesystem encoding problems running oc in iis, setlocale en_us.utf8 not allowed in windows
body:
### actual behaviour
setlocale(en_us.utf8) does not work if owncloud is running on windows. furthermore folders or files containing german umlauts (ã¤,ã¶,ã¼,ãÿ) created via the web-interface are not displayed correctly in windows explorer.

creating a folder in the filesystem (/username/files/test-ã–ã„ãœ/) also results in an error (see the following forum thread for details: http://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=3577)

additional information provided at:

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/x99tb11d%28v=vs.80%29.aspx

"the set of available languages, country/region codes, and code pages includes all those supported by the win32 nls api except code pages that require more than two bytes per character, such as utf-7 and utf-8. if you provide a code page like utf-7 or utf-8, setlocale will fail, returning null. the set of language and country/region codes supported by setlocale is listed in language and country/region strings."

possible solution: use iconv to convert file and foldernames from and to filesystem if php is running in iis

### steps to reproduce
1. create a folder containing at least one umlaut (ã„,ã–,ãœ) via web-interface -> incorrect in windows explorer
2. create a folder containing at least one umlaut (ã„,ã–,ãœ) via windows explorer -> see forum thread

### server configuration
operating system: windows server 2012

web server: iis 8 (php is running as a fast-cgi module)

database: mysql 5.6.9

php version: 5.4 / 5.5 alpha 3

owncloud version: 4.5 / 5.0
